Author: septumrings
Text: i felt the same way when i went to my first appointment, but any psychologist who knows about eating disorders should know that you need help and to recover no matter what weight you're at. an eating disorder is devastating no matter what diagnosis or weight category you're given, and you do not need to be UW for your ed to be legitimate and equally as impactful as it is then.  i started out in the same situation btw, and now that my ed is continuing to progress, its becoming much more difficult to recover than i had imagined. i really am wishing you the best of luck in recovery, and if you need to talk to anyone or just vent, don't be afraid to reach out.

Author: peanut_nibbles
Text: I have the same thought process and I think we both know it’s not healthy or correct. You need to remember that weight is only a symptom of an eating disorder and it does not define how serious your disorder is. Everyone deserves recovery at every weight. Please look after yourself and remember you don’t need to be underweight to deserve recovery. X
